statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Fairfield 88, Rider 76
article.story: BRIDGEPORT, Conn. (AP) -- Warren Edney and Marty O'Sullivan each scored a career-high 18 points to lead Fairfield University in an 88-76 victory over Rider on Saturday. The Stags (11-14, 9-6) outscored the Broncs 42-27 in the second half to extend their winning streak to four games. O'Sullivan scored 11 of his points after the break, and Mamadou Diakhate came off the bench to hit two momentum-changing 3-pointers in the final 10 minutes. Jason Thompson, who finished with 20 points, made a pair of foul shots to give Rider (18-8, 11-4) a 68-66 lead with 7:26 to play. But Diakhate answered with back-to-back 3-pointers that gave the Stags a 74-68 lead, and Fairfield never trailed again the final 6:18 of play. With Thompson -- a projected NBA first-round pick in June -- battling first-half foul trouble, the Broncs made their mark behind the 3-point line, shooting 7-for-10 from there. Kamron Warner led the way with three 3-pointers and 11 points in the half. The Stags used a 10-2 run late in the first half to tie the game at 46-46 with 19.5 seconds left. Herb Allen and Mike Evanovich hit back-to-back 3-pointers on the run. Justin Robinson's 3-pointer with 3 seconds in the half broke the tie and gave Rider a 49-46 halftime edge. After shooting 57.6 percent (19-for-33) from the field in the first half, the Broncs cooled in the second half and shot 40.7 percent (11-for-27), and were just 2-of-6 from 3-point range. Thompson also had five rebounds and three blocks in the loss, while teammates Harris Mansell finished with 16 points. Anthony Johnson added 13 points for the Stags and Jonathan Han added 10 points and seven assists.
